parameters.name: lookup_filter
parameters.description:
The values of verification fields to filter by (e.g., email, phone number).
Depends on what verification method is used by the underlying application. This is a
comma-separated list of values.

parameters.name: id_filter
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of user IDs to filter by. If any ID is not found, it will be excluded from the response.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of users to return per query. Max is 1000

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Returns the next page of results after the user ID (inclusive)

parameters.name: include_duplicates
parameters.description: Include multiple users if they are found using the lookup and id filters

put.description:
Inserts or updates user data. If Rownd should generate its own ID for this record,
set `__uuid__` or `__objectid__` as the `user` path parameter. `__uuid__` will result
in a v4 uuid and `__objectid__` will result in a BSON ObjectID.

parameters.name: preview
parameters.description: Return an image thumbnail of the resource

parameters.name: fail_on_error
parameters.description: Return a 403 status code if the field is unshared by the user

200.description: The value of the data field
The value of the data field

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description:
The end date of the analytics range.
Defaults to the current date.
Cannot be more than 90 days later than the start date.
Use ISO8601 format

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description:
The resolution of the analytics data.
Defaults to day.

get.description: Platform API for listing all groups belonging to an app

post.description: Platform API for creating a new group

get.description: Platform API for retrieving a group

put.description: Platform API for updating a group

delete.description: Platform API for deleting a group

get.description: Platform API for listing group members

post.description:
Platform API for creating a member within the group. You can create a member by providing a user
ID or a user lookup value like an email address or phone number. The first member created within
a group will automatically be assigned the `'owner'` role.

put.description: Platform API for updating a group member

delete.description: Platform API for deleting a group member

post.description: Platform API for creating a group invite

link.description:
The invitation link. Your user will use this link to accept the invite. 
For now, you will need to send this link to your users. In the future, Rownd will 
automatically send out invites via email or SMS for you

get.description: Platform API for listing group invites

get.description: User-facing API for listing groups

post.description: User-facing API for creating a new group. The callee is automatically added with the `"owner"` role.

get.description: User-facing API for retrieving a group

put.description: User-facing API for updating a group

delete.description: User-facing API for deleting a group

get.description: User-facing API for listing group members

post.description: User-facing API for creating a group member

get.description: User-facing API for retrieving a group member

put.description: User-facing API for updating a group member

delete.description: User-facing API for deleting a group member

post.description:
User-facing API for creating a group invite. An invite can be created for a user by providing
their `user_id`, `email`, or `phone`. Once accepted, the user will be added as a member within
the group and be assigned the roles specified in the invite.

get.description: User-facing API for listing group invites
User-facing API for retrieving a group invite

put.description: User-facing API for updating a group invite

delete.description: User-facing API for deleting a group invite

post.description:
User-facing API for accepting a group invite. If the acceptance is successful, the user will be
redirected to the invite's `redirect_url`.

This is a special property for generating Platform magic links with a Specific
subdomain. This is currently used to generate a magic deep link for pairing a
device during mobile tagging.

auth_tokens.description: Present only when the app allows unverified users and the current one isn't already in the system.

init_data.description: Present only when the app allows unverified users and the current one isn't already in the system.

is_anonymous.description: Indicates that this user is anonymous and doesn't need to provide any information.

always_send_verification_message.description: send the verification message no matter what

redirect.description: set to false to prevent redirecting after verification

turnstile_challenge_response.description: The challenge response from Cloudflare Turnstile

intent.description: Specific intent for sign in request

continue_with_email.description: prevent any other sign in methods when signing in with email

group_to_join.description:
ID of a group to which the user will join upon completing sign-in. The group
must have an admission policy of 'open'.

auth_tokens.description: Present only when the app allows unverified users and the current one isn't already in the system.

init_data.description: Present only when the app allows unverified users and the current one isn't already in the system.

intent_mismatch_behavior.description: Controls legacy behavior where a token request with an intent that doesn't match the intent of the original sign in request would return 200 OK with certain response properties vs. throwing an error. This is the default behavior, but can be overridden to throw an error instead, which is preferred and may become the default in the future.

user_data.description: User data to add to the app user. Not valid for Rownd refresh token exchanges

group_to_join.description:
ID of a group to which the user will join upon completing sign-in. The group
must have an admission policy of 'open'.

user_id.description: bring your own user id. Can be `__uuid__` or `__objectid__`. This will not override an existing user`

expiration.description: A string representing the duration for which a magic link is valid.

group_to_join.description:
ID of a group to which the user will join upon completing sign-in. The group
must have an admission policy of 'open'.

allow_reuse.description:
Enable or disable re-using refresh tokens.
For security, reuse is disabled by default, but can be enabled globally.
FUTURE: A user's meta can also include `refresh_token_reuse: enabled|disabled`
to selectively enable/disable for a specific individual.

ttl.description:
A string representing the time for which a refresh token is valid. This value is
used to compute the `exp` claim value when generating refresh tokens.

source.description: From where does this claim originate?

use_explicit_sign_up_flow.description: separates the sign in and sign up modals

primary_sign_up_method.description: Primary sign up method used for creating new user after no account was found.

verify_template.description: an overide for the Postmark verification email template

custom_content.description: custom text content added to the email

custom_closing_content.description: custom closing text content added to the email

title.description: custom text for title of download screen

custom_content.description: custom text content added below title

ios_client_id.description: The Google OAuth client ID for IOS

scopes.description: An optional list of Google OAuth scopes

auto_prompt.description: Should the One Tap UI display on page load if a user is not authenticated

delay.description: Delay in ms before the One Tap UI will appear

auto_prompt.description: Should the One Tap UI display on app startup if a user is not authenticated

delay.description: Delay in ms before the One Tap UI will appear

domains.description: The domain (relying party) where this passkey is used (e.g., example.com)

registration_prompt_frequency.description: A string representing how often a user should be prompted to set up a passkey if they haven't done so.

scopes.description: An optional list of OAuth2 scopes

issuer.description: The OAuth2 issuer URL (if using a non-default value)

challenge_duration.description: The length of time for which auth challenges are valid

add_sign_in_methods_button.description: profile add sign in methods button customization

order.description: The order in which the automation should be displayed

attribute.description: The user_data field, or metadata/scope attribute to check

value.description: A URL, HTML selector, or event name

target.description: The event target if the type is 'EVENT' or 'MOBILE_EVENT'

args.description: Arguments to pass to the action handler.

updated_by.description: User identifier who last updated the application

app_id.description: The ID of the app to which the variant is associated

config.description: An object containing app config overrides

updated_by.description: The ID of the user that last updated the variant

redirect_url.description:
The user will be sent an SMS message with a link that will redirect to this URL. If
`mobile_enabled` is set to `true`, this should be a deep link to your app containing
your app's subdomain. (e.g. https://myapp.rownd.link/some/path)

mobile_enabled.description: If true, the generated sign-in link sent to the user will deep link into your mobile app

new_user_response.description: The message sent to new users when they text the keyword

existing_user_response.description: The message sent to existing users when they text the keyword

app_id.description: The ID of the app to which the sms keyword is associated

app_variant_id.description: The ID of the variant to which the sms keyword is associated

updated_by.description: The ID of the user that last updated the variant

plaintext_viewers.description: If method is 'server', this dictates who can see the decrypted value

collection_justification.description: Collates all of the collection justifications across form fields

data_use_labels.description: Must match data uses from app schema

name.description: Must match a schema property name

estimated_duration.description: The estimated initialization duration in seconds

total_steps.description: The total number of initialization steps

success_message.description: A message that is displayed when a connection is created successfully. It can include templated config variables like {{config.variable_name}}

sample_data_types.description: A non-exhaustive list of data types that map to default Rownd-provided (or custom) data types.

application.description: The application ID to which you want to attach this connection
The application ID from which you want to detach this connection

action_type.description: Connectors may provide arbitrary actions that can be invoked during the setup process of a particular connection.

last_sign_in.description: Which method this account last used to sign in.

reason.description: A description of why an action was rejected

member_count.description: This value is no longer provided by the API. The default value of 0 will always be returned

admission_policy.description: Set whether the group be open for anyone to join or by invite only

user_id.description: The ID of a user to add as a group member. The user must belong to the Rownd application.

roles.description:
The roles that the member belongs. (The first member added or invited to a group will
always be created with the 'owner' role along with any additional roles specified)

invited_by.description: The authenticated party that invited the user to the group

added_by.description: The authenticated party that added the user to the gruop

GroupMemberState.description:
The state of the group member. A member that has been invited will not go into the `active`
state until they accept the invitation.

roles.description:
The roles into which a group member will be added upon invite acceptance (The first 
member invited to a group will always be created with the 'owner' role along with any
additional roles specified)

email.description:
The email of a Rownd user in the specified application. This property is mutually exclusive 
with `user_id` and `email`

phone.description:
The phone number of a Rownd user in the specified application. This property is mutually
exclusive with `user_id` and `email`

user_id.description:
The ID of a Rownd user in the specified application. This property is mutually exclusive with 
`phone` and `email`

user_lookup_value.description: The email or phone number specified during creation

redirect_url.description: The relative or absolute path location to which a user will be directed after accepting the invite

app_variant_id.description:
The ID of an application variant for which this invite should be created. When a user accepts
this invite, they will be added to the group as a member and signed into this application
variant. (Learn about variants [here](/configuration/customizations/sub-brands))

accepted_by.description: The ID of the user that accepted the invite

ensured_user_id.description: The ID of the user ensured by the provided `user_id` or `user_lookup_value`
